result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order on motion to seal/redact court record

records.addlTxt: on Motion To Seal or Redact a Court Record
Further proceedings on August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days).  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety for pendency of case, except for prescribed medication.  No use or possession of dangerous weapons/firearms.  Law Enforcement Office must assist in securing personal property. No contact with T.C.
Deft appears while in custody via video.  Further Proceedings scheduled in Court Commissioner.
